website_summaries.verdict: An attractive Oster toaster with 4 slots and a brushed stainless steel finish that toasts most items evenly, but the slots could be wider and toasting on the higher settings requires monitoring.
pros: Offers 4 slots that makes it perfect for toasting items for groups or families
Retractable cord is an added convenience
Sleek, stainless steel finish has a modern look
cons: Not all thick breads will fit
Higher settings are likely to burn
Most of the exterior gets hot when toasting
Takes up a lot of space

customer_reviews.title: The only thing good about this toaster is the retractable cord
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk! This is replacing a Hamilton Beach that we had for about 13 years. First thing taking it out of the box was I noticed how light weight and cheap feeling it was. After about 3 uses the right side wouldn't always start on pushing the handle down, took several tries. Now today neither side will start. The only thing good about this toaster is the retractable cord. I live down in Mexico and it's not worth my time and hassle to send it back. Bought this because it was an Amazon Best Buy. Should have listened to the negative reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Strokerdave

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Toaster
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality. Bottom half of toast was burned and top half was raw. Bagel setting is supposed to only toast cut side of bagel and this toaster incinerated both sides even when set at lowest heat setting. Not recommended!
customer_reviews.author: LDM

customer_reviews.title: "You're called a toaster, for crying out loud"! " So Toast!!!
customer_reviews.text: What was I thinking? Buying this toaster is one of those moments where I start to question my grip on sanity. Folks, there are literally hundreds (maybe thousands) of models and makes out there. DON'T do what I did. You could probably close your eyes and point a random one out and it will be a better choice than this contraption. Be kind to yourself and shop around (or away) from this one. Everything about this toaster is wrong. The four slots for the bread are too small for regular sliced bread, toasting level is laughably random, so sometimes it burns your toast and sometimes it warms them up..... nicely!
customer_reviews.author: juandelpueblo

customer_reviews.title: It is of great quality and is at a price point anyone can ...
customer_reviews.text: I looked quite a bit at the different models available and read the reviews, but when I came across this Oster Brand, I knew that this was the one. It is of great quality and is at a price point anyone can afford. This Oster has a retractable cord and can handle narrow and wide slices of what ever you want to put into it. The dials on the front are your settings for the degree of browning preferred and the buttons are settings for frozen, bagel, reheating and cancel of your food preparation choices. The nice stainless steel finish matches my other appliances..couldn't be happier with my choice!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 1/2 months
customer_reviews.text: It broke after 2 1/2 months. One morning, the push levers just stopped working. When you push down, they wont lock in place to start the toaster. Amazon's return window was only 30 days and I have contacted the customer service area of the manufacturer 2 times with no response other than "your email has been received and we will respond within 3 business days", which i have never been contacted. Guess I need to move on and write it off and buy a different toaster as I miss my morning toast.Prior to it breaking, I was enjoying it and would have recommended.
customer_reviews.author: patti cripps

customer_reviews.title: Slots are not deep or long enough for anything other than standard size of bread.
customer_reviews.text: Unless you are only toasting wonder bread sized toast, this toaster will not accommodate your bread. The slots are too short or deep enough. So for example if you are trying to toast a piece of rye bread - forget it. The top part of the bread will not drop down into the toaster. I think this is a fatal flaw. It will toast bagels fine. The slots are wide enough. Speed is pretty average. Makes no noise when toast pops up to notify you that it is done. No ding or anything.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Does not toast correctly
customer_reviews.text: It does not toast good for me. I like how the cord retracts and is placed on the side of toaster. But it seems to toast the bottom of the bread and not the top. I have set at 3, 4 and 5. 5 burns the toast but not the whole piece of toast. Set it at 4 and the bottom of the bread is toasted dark and the top of the bread is light. Either way I use this toaster my toast is either under toasted or over toasted and dry.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Swift

customer_reviews.title: The cord does not retract as easily as I'd like
customer_reviews.text: The toaster produces toast that is very consistent to the temperature setting. That is all I really expect from a toaster. The cord does not retract as easily as I'd like, but who cares? I just leave it pulled all the way out like every toaster I've ever owned before. I would have given the toaster 5 stars if the cord was not meant to contract. Since they made it retract, they should have put the effort in to make it retract easily ever time. As the saying goes, "It is better to under-promise and over-deliver."
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: It's an affordable 4 slicer but Eggo waffles don't go ...
customer_reviews.text: It's an affordable 4 slicer but Eggo waffles don't go down far enough to toast the whole waffle. The top of the waffle stays cold while the rest of it is toasted.
customer_reviews.author: atgcpaul

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love the retro look. So far it toasts bread perfect. I like mine a little darker, so put it on #4. But for Bagels, #2 or it will be too dark. I don't use the frozen, or bagel button because it has come out too dark. I'm sure it's a trial and error thing. It has a lift on the handle, so after toast pops up you can lift higher for easier extraction. And if you want to have it pop up quicker, move the dial all the way to the left! I'm very happy with this toaster!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rickety and Disappointing, but Not Enough to Return
customer_reviews.text: This toaster looks all shiny, impressive and solid, that's true. Observable facts about this toaster is that it is rickety and flimsy when pushing the lever down to use it. It does not accommodate a slice of rye bread. Most buttons don't seem to have any discernible effect. This is one of the more disappointing purchases I've made lately, because it's not quite bad enough to return it, but it might last long enough that I will end up hating it rather than just being disappointed. Ugh.
customer_reviews.author: Family of Four

customer_reviews.title: We can both have our toast!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time, well packed. We love the idea that we can both have toast at the same time. No more waiting for the toaster to pop so we can start a couple more slices of bread. It looks nice on the counter and is easy to clean, slide out crumb "drawers" on the back at the bottom edge. It has a retractable cord that keeps things neater and saves space.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Used is becoming a crap shoot with Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Purchased used. Amazon description of used is slowly getting diluted into damaged goods. Mine arrived in inadequate packaging resulting in shipping damage. I opted to bend the metal housing myself. Very nice looking and functional toaster. All the high end settings and nice wide slotes. Very even toasting on both sides.
customer_reviews.author: Armando Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Utter JUNK, AVOID
customer_reviews.text: Uneven toasting from day 1, but adjusted the settings hoping for improvement to no avail. Build quality is poor and it is cheaply made utilizing thin sheet metal. Forgot to engage a return as we don't use it everyday and now I'm 5 days post return time, and now one slot won't go down except for multiple pushes, then it wont pop up. Is it really this hard to make a toaster? I wonder how NASA or MIT makes toast. Que the flushing sound of $35. Going back to KRUPS , bye bye Oster. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising
customer_reviews.text: We wanted the toaster because of the bagel feature. but it toasted the same as toast, on both sides. sense you have a bagel button it should only cook on one side. You people that make this toaster should check to see if if all the functions work before you sell it. We are sending this none bagel toaster back. Our old Black & Decker still works good, but only has place for 2 slices of toast. You have a nice looking toaster, to bad it doesn't work properly. Good by Oster.
customer_reviews.author: Winston Randall Earl

customer_reviews.title: I really like the retractable cord
customer_reviews.text: I really like the retractable cord. It's something you didn't know you need until you have it. In this world of wires all over the damn place, it's nice to have a convenient, compact place to store it. More appliances should have this feature. I've opened up some toasters, blenders, etc. Plenty of them have a lot of empty space inside and could easily fit the mechanism with little design change.
customer_reviews.author: Barrett V.

customer_reviews.title: Toasts but....
customer_reviews.text: The feet of the toaster do not have much grip on regular counter top surfaces. Consequently, the toaster slides around every time you touch a control. The "Frozen" light does not work on the right side control set. On its maiden use (without toast) it did smoke, stink, and set off the kitchen smoke detector but after that the factory stuff was burned off. There should be a graphic showing the right way to insert a bagel or bun because one side of the slot heats differently on the bagel setting. On the plus side, it does toast bread as advertised. The retractable power cord is a nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: Machinery Hero

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it.  Suggest different model
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely do not buy this. I’m still using mine but after a year, I have to crank it almost all of the way up just to toast bread, doesn’t toast evenly. I suggest this one instead: Cuisinart CPT-435FR I’ve been using it for 6 months at another house. Love it! Edit: can’t recommend the Cuisinart CPT-435. It works fine however I have to keep darkness level all the way up. Otherwise great toaster
customer_reviews.author: Gazoo

customer_reviews.title: Have Mine for Many Years - Ordering another for vacation home
customer_reviews.text: Really like the look of the toaster and the retractable cord. The dial settings work really well. I've had this toaster for over 6 years and it's like new. We have another brand of toaster (famous manufacturer beginning with Cuis.....) that is not nearly as good. Replacing it this week with this one.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ehrlich

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 11 months, then half of it quit.
customer_reviews.text: Toaster was great right up to month 11 of ownership when the right side toaster failed. It used to make great evenly browned toast, looked nice, and had a retractable cord for easy storage. Our old dual slot Cuisinart ran for 9 years, less than one just doesn't cut it for me. I've been wanting to try a toaster oven... I guess this is a good excuse to move on.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Not much of a toaster
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this toaster as a used item & it wouldn't work very well so I returned it & bought new. It doesn't work very well either. It toasts quickly but unevenly- very unevenly. If I hadn't already returned it once I would definitely return it * get another brand of toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Neal

customer_reviews.title: Meh... that'll do pig... that'll do...
customer_reviews.text: First one came with one side non-functional. Second unit arrived and works as desired. Have to crank up the power compared to my old Delonghi unit, but it cooks evenly and quickly. Overall build quality, you can see why this is as "cheap" as it is. The handles have plastic arms and I'm not certain how firm the dials will remain after time. I'm optimistic this will at least survive my children for a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Clone Number 3

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: So now that it is tens months later . If I could put no stars I would ! I have had it yes ,10 months . It gets weekend use only . Two times each weekend . So 2O times total ..... It will not longer heat up !!! Do not buy this toaster waste of time and money . Shame on you Oaster . Done with your products . Another landfill item for America . Worst item ever in all my purchases , and I am a shopper .
customer_reviews.author: SJA

customer_reviews.title: This toaster does its job and makes me happy. I learned a trick with frozen waffles- put ...
customer_reviews.text: I get giddy when my whole family can eat warm toast together. This toaster does its job and makes me happy. I learned a trick with frozen waffles- put them in for 4 minutes with "frozen" pressed, then flip them and cook them (not on frozen) for 2 more minutes. Makes them nice and crunchy, which is my preferred quality in a frozen waffle.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Worked fair-to-good for 6 months, worked only middling for 16 months, broke entirely at 22 months
customer_reviews.text: easy to use and reasonably easy to clean, looked nice. Started out okay for 6 months, although it never toasted exactly evenly, but it did well enough. Then after 6 months it started getting harder to get toast to "catch" and I often had to try several times to lower in the bread. It also started toasting unevenly, and I would have to reverse sides halfway through to get them equally brown. This morning, a little short of 2 years-old and it won't work at all. I'm not giving it an overall 1-start review because it appears that lots of toasters only last a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Should read "slicer."
customer_reviews.text: The sides of this are machine pressured into the main frame. They are not attached in any manner. If the toaster is banged in any manner, they pop open permanently. Today I sliced my finger open. Another brand was ordered. The electrical components are exposed. Really poorly made.
customer_reviews.author: FL in the burgh

customer_reviews.title: Makes room-temperature bagels hotter
customer_reviews.text: Makes room-temperature bagels hotter. Three stars as it does not seem to have the umpf required to lift the bagels back above the top of the toaster when they are done. I have to lift on the lever to get them to a level that allows me to grab them without reaching into the slots. I don't like swearing in front of my kids. I feel like I would if I stuck my fingers in there.
customer_reviews.author: Napali

customer_reviews.title: 5 years of sporadic use in good, clean conditions - seems to be a power ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked well, but completely (and suddenly) died after 3.5 years of sporadic use in good, clean conditions - seems to be a power problem, since none of the buttons even light up anymore. 1/5 stars because this is not something that should be happening to an electronic device this decade. Toasters are not complicated devices, and a $45 toaster should not turn into a paperweight after 4 years.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: This toaster broke after 5 months and is not even used daily. For a $40 cost, I believe a toaster should last much longer. Now I need to purchase another toaster to replace, but it won't be the same one. Was good while it lasted though!
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine King

customer_reviews.title: Great for 23 months then quit working. I expect more for a $40 toaster.
customer_reviews.text: It was great for the first two years then one night, neither side works. It's like a little timer went off exactly 23 months to the day that we first used it. Check the power and that's fine. Neither side will stay down and no heat. Is there a circuit breaker in the toaster itself? It's not mentioned in the manual if there is.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: AVOID - Inferior Quality
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality - handles made out of plastics. I've owned numerous toasters in my life and this is by far the lowest quality toaster i have ever owned. the handles are made out of plastic and are already feeling loose (and definitely very flimsy) after 2 days of use. the manufacturers try to save a little money by using inferior quality and customers need to be aware of it. this item is going right back.
customer_reviews.author: SAB-LA

customer_reviews.title: A Good Sturdy Toaster.
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as a donation to a homeless shelter and it has stood up to being used by lots of people every day. I had purchased a different brand and it was broken in a week! Our guests like that it is easy to adjust the level of toasting and that almost any sized bread is usable and easy to get out.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So happy this comes in red now
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. I originally ordered the solid chrome version of this toaster and was happy with it, but really wanted a red toaster to match my kitchen so when my daughter needed a toaster I used this opportunity to order the red version and give my daughter my chrome toaster. Has all the features I wanted in a toaster and more than happy with my new toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Tammyoeo

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing and unreliable
customer_reviews.text: We bought this toaster on Amazon less than a year as go and it already needs replacement. Half the toaster doesn't work now so it only toasts 2 slices not 4. Even when you set the controls it doesnt toast dark enough. We are very disappointed with this toaster and are replacing it . I'm sorry to say we will not buy another Oster.
customer_reviews.author: John D

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: We bought this toaster and liked it. It's nice looking, but it always toasted one side of the bread more than the other. Then after using for about 6 months it just stopped working. Waste of money. We were bummed out.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Who Reads

customer_reviews.title: Great metal toaster!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted a toaster that was metal. We have a two slice metal toaster from the 50's that works fantastic but is in our camper. Needed a 4 slice metal toaster for at home. Did a lot of reading and decided on this toaster. It is a brushed metal with just plastic at the bottom. We have been very happy with it! Toasts even and has not burned any thing! Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Denise Sweitzer

customer_reviews.title: Decent toaster.
customer_reviews.text: We got this like new from warehouse deals for a pretty good price and it works just fine. The heat is distributed equally to all 8 sides of the toast/bread. The only thing what would be a bit better if the crumb tray could be pulled from the front and not back, but it's not a big issue. It also toasts bagels very well. With our toaster I can suggest to start with turning the buttons to half the way so it will not burn the toast. Higher setting will burn it. My wife fell in love with the toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Communications

customer_reviews.title: I don’t feel like they get down deep enough to be exposed to ...
customer_reviews.text: I was replacing our two slot Hamilton Beach toaster that has worked flawlessly for 14 years. I laughed at all the toaster reviews comparing toast but I get it now! This toaster toasts unevenly...sliced bread and bagels are fairly untoasted at the top and dark at the bottom. I don’t feel like they get down deep enough to be exposed to the heating element. It’s annoying!
customer_reviews.author: Summer Goddard

customer_reviews.title: Had to Replace Twice
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd one we received. The first one lasted less than a month and we had to return it because the "lifters" stopped working. We are now waiting for Oster to send us our 3rd unit. The second one worked fine for a few months and then started toasting very unevenly. For the bread to be toasted on the bottom, the top would be burnt. I will say Oster customer service is great. They are replacing the unit without any problem. I would have expected better quality from Oster.
customer_reviews.author: Mary K.

customer_reviews.title: It should be called a Burner.....
customer_reviews.text: Been using it 3 months and it is hands down the worst toaster I've used. The toasting stoped working on one side and then started again. Bagels get stuck all the time. The toast dials mean nothing..... setting 2 toasts light and then the next time black. Now one side has completely stopped working and the other side just burns - even on setting 1. Can't return since it's past the return time. AVOID. THIS. TOASTER. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: S. Tomlinson

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Gosh, I'm so disappointed in this toaster. I bought it less than a year ago, used it very little, and today it just died. I expected better from Oster.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Eichblatt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Toaster
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT! :) Toaster don't seem to last as long as they used to so we've gotten used to replacing ours every 3-4 years -- one lesson we learned is that you do not want to buy any of the toaster that have 'digital lights' for the settings... they always burn out well before the life of the toaster is over. This toaster has none of that which is great!!! We love all the features and settings and easy read dial numbers. This is a good one!!
customer_reviews.author: MP_Mace

customer_reviews.title: Over all a solid toaster
customer_reviews.text: Makes good toast. Were not toast snobs and this works fine. So far the retractable cord is nice but at times I have to pull it in and out to get it to go all the way in. Over all for the price is a solid toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: I expected better from Oster.
customer_reviews.text: This toaster was larger than I expected, but it made nice toast. For a while. I've lost faith in a brand I've trusted for years. Eight months after purchasing this toaster, one side completely stopped working. What good is a GIANT ASS toaster if it only makes two slices of toast? Shame on you, Oster; you used to be good company with high quality products but now you're just like all the other crappy companies pushing cheap, shoddy, made-to-fail garbage. Boo.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really nice.
customer_reviews.text: One thing not mentioned a lot is how good the design looks sitting on a counter. We also got a black cover for ours. As for the toasting - it's not 100% perfect but it's been very good on everything we've put in it. And it's been used a lot so far. Toast, bagels, frozen waffles all come out nice. Also of note; the mechanism is silky smooth. Sure hope it holds up. These days, many appliances don't always last like they did back in the day.
customer_reviews.author: J.Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but that’s about it
customer_reviews.text: Started out fine, toasted very evenly and quickly. 6 months later one side works intermittently. 1 year later the other side no longer toasts evenly and we have to set it very high. Felt flimsy right from the start and now it’s really gone downhill. I would suggest looking elsewhere if you want a product that will last.
customer_reviews.author: elseven

customer_reviews.title: This toaster is beautiful and the red sides are gorgeous
customer_reviews.text: This toaster is beautiful and the red sides are gorgeous. There's a variety of options on the front, depending on what you want to toast. The wide openings are ideal for even the fattest bagels. I love the retractable cord because you don't have extra cord sitting on the counter looking ugly. So happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MariaR

customer_reviews.title: The toaster that could!
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this toaster for 6 months now with no problems. Toasts evenly in an adequate amount of time. The retractable power cord is a must have and has not floundered yet. I always use my appliances for awhile before writing a review as to get an honest and tested period of use to get an accurate feel for an appliances' durability, functionality, and dependability.
customer_reviews.author: Lucien M.

customer_reviews.title: Complete Junk!!
customer_reviews.text: Owned this toaster for just over a month and it no longer works. Neither side will remain down to turn on the toaster. Only solution from the manufacture was to clean toaster of any crumbs, which was done, checked and rechecked. If that didn't work, it said to take it to an authorized dealer, so I sent it to the local landfill where it belongs. Owned product from July 15 - Aug 22, 2016. Complete piece of junk. No scews to take it apart. just 15 bent pieces of aluminum to remove the base, then the whole thing fell apart. Wasn't worth any more of my time. Walk away from this product and save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Yeti

customer_reviews.title: Not the same Oster that used to put out quality
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why but we had very similar oster Toasters at work that lasted for years that the reason we bought this one...here 4 months later, it is not working anymore and the insides are falling apart.. The funny thing about it is we only toast at home a bagel or bread maybe 3 times a week.. At work constantly 7 days a week.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Oddi

customer_reviews.title: Red toaster
customer_reviews.text: Arrived fast but, was excited when I got it. I had to return the first one came damaged. The second one stopped working properly after a year. It's works when it works now. Very disappointed...
customer_reviews.author: Bunkybutt

customer_reviews.title: Well crafted and attractive
customer_reviews.text: This toaster works well - very easy to program and to interrupt the toast function if you want to stop it before it completes its cycle. The crumb trays slide out easily so that you can empty them each time you toast. When you start the toast function, there are a pair of grids which grab the bread/bagel, etc., to hold it centrally while toasting. I purchased the unit for myself and I swap off the left and right each time I use it - thus extending the life of the coils on each side. The unit itself is very light weight and easily transportable around the kitchen. The exterior has remained quite clean after each use.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Do No Purchase! Became a throwaway in 60 days.
customer_reviews.text: Do Not Purchase! With less than 2 months of limited use one slot of each pair no longer pushes the toast up. The holder stays down in the back. Made with inferior materials. A waste of good money. Return period expired 9 days ago.
customer_reviews.author: EW

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse...with a slight flaw
customer_reviews.text: This is a workhorse toaster, sturdy enough to survive a fall from over 4'. Works well but... There's a design flaw: the crumb trays. They're located at the back, rather than the front: quite inconvenient. To access them, I must unplug the unit completely and turn it around. Additionally, without them in the front I tend to forget to clean the trays. Despite this, I must reiterate: a WORKHORSE of a toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Nanny Springer

customer_reviews.title: The perfect toaster, without a doubt!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a toaster that works. Thanks!! The level dials work well as to the toasting level; the surface is clean in design so easy to clean up; the slice openings are wide enough for a thick bagel or a thick slice of home made bread. I have had nothing but problems trying to find that "perfect" toaster and this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, works - meh.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this toaster because I have a 1932 house, and the retro look goes with my kitchen. Love the look, but unfortunately, it does not actually toast very well. On the very darkest setting, I have to toast a slice of bread four times to get it medium toasted. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: D. Duncan

customer_reviews.title: If you only need it to work for two months...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a B&D unit that I had owned for many years. Little over two months later and the unit is now dead. Both sides act like there is no power. Verified the power outlet and it is good. Not a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: J. McConn

customer_reviews.title: To HOT to touch !!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This toaster gets HOT not warm,HOT as in finger burning HOT. All 4 sides from halfway up to the top are untouchable. So much for "Amazon's Choice",waste of money and very disappointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: G.McG

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Toaster!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, wow, and wow!!! This is the best toaster that I personally have ever had. Once you find the setting that works for you, you get great toast every time!! I got this, because at the time I was eating about 4 pieces of toast a day. Now, I only eat 2 pieces, but I don't regret the investment. I have used this every day for about 3.5 months, and have had great toast every time.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Leavell

customer_reviews.title: Best Toaster EVER
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I have bought many toasters, this one is the BEST, It actually makes toast the way toast is suppose to be made, the other toasters I have tried would pretty much just warm the bread with the smallest amount of golden toast color. I would RECOMMEND this toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Rita Heilman

customer_reviews.title: OSTER 4 Slice Toaster Review
customer_reviews.text: For the price this Oster 4 slice Toaster is ok. You have to really look on how you place your bread or bagel inside the toaster because only one side of the wall will light up and brown your toast. The price was right and I have no complaints about this purchase. The seller sent this item quickly and it was securely wrapped for mailing.
customer_reviews.author: Eilean Du

customer_reviews.title: Excellent toaster
customer_reviews.text: As with any new toaster, there is a burn-off smell, from the heating elements, which is transferred to the toast, the first time you use the toaster. Consequently, you should expect your first toast to be sacrificial. After that, it toasted perfectly and without odor, giving us evenly-colored, golden-browned toast, at the medium setting, which is how we like our toast.
customer_reviews.author: G. Hungerford

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster
customer_reviews.text: Great toaster. I love the frozen setting for toasting things like frozen waffles. It toasts them nicely without over drying them like my old toaster. The cancel setting is also a plus so you can stop the process at any time without resorting to unplugging and digging out with a fork, etc. Sometimes the tops do not get completely toasted so I just flip the items over, toast for a minute, then hit "cancel" and all is well. I have had this now for almost a year and love it. The retractable cord is the icing on the cake, by the way.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Certified Piece of Junk (CPOK)
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased late last December and in less than 9 months it has failed. The spring mechanism gets stuck making it difficult or impossible to insert toast. You can unplug it and adjust the wire mechanism if you want, but once it starts happening, it will require you to do this regularly. As for usage, it is my wife and I and we don't use it every day. It hasn't been abused.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: They better replace it too out of goodwill
customer_reviews.text: A month out of warranty and it does not work. Suddenly it stopped working. No lights, or any indication it has power. The slide won't stay down. A toaster should last decades. Junk. They better replace it too out of goodwill. In the return process now.
customer_reviews.author: John Whitbread

customer_reviews.title: I cant believe how bad this irritates me
customer_reviews.text: Worked 2 times then it quit. Followed all instructions, how worthless they were to the letter. I cant believe how bad this irritates me.
customer_reviews.author: sparky

customer_reviews.title: Brave Little Toaster
customer_reviews.text: I bought this nice little toaster to replace a monstrocity of a toaster oven we had that took up our entire counter when we pulled it out to toast bread. It doesn't toast evenly on both sides, but it does its job. My old toaster oven only toasted half the bread, so this is a huge improvement. Nice little toaster. I like that the cord rolls up inside, but I have a feeling that little feature won't last long.
customer_reviews.author: C. Fishback

customer_reviews.title: Nice toaster, with several options!
customer_reviews.text: We've gone through so many toasters in just a few years. They all just stopped working or would burn our toast, even on the lowest setting! We decided on this one because of the good reviews, and we are so glad we did! We've had this for 2 years now, and it still works like it's brand new. The different options and settings ensure that we have the perfect toast/bagel/pastry. The stainless steel wipes down nicely, and it doesn't take up huge amount of counterspace!
customer_reviews.author: Alf1126

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this toaster for about two weeks, but I am very happy with it so far. I have not experienced any issues with asymmetric toasting as some other reviews have noted. I have been toasting both loaf bread and bagels amf have had consistent results. Inalso apprecite the the outside wall do not become overly warm and is touchable after use. I think I certainly made a great choice and this toaster has offered the bang for the buck spent. I would not consider purchasing a more expensive toaster. Not product related, but I received the item in a timely manner and it was packaged well.
customer_reviews.author: Nellie

customer_reviews.title: Cadillac Toaster
customer_reviews.text: I a.m. overjoyed with this toaster. I am so glad I bought it. The color is absolutely beautiful and goes perfect with my Red Theme. The toaster slots are extra big and can toast about anything and if I just want a couple of seconds you just push the proper function button on the sides. I’m so glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: It functions fine. Owned for 4 years
customer_reviews.text: Is it the greatest toaster in the world, no. Does it make toast and bagels, yes. Are you nut job "toasty" that needs their toast at precise point on the color index, well maybe this isn't for you. Are you a regular schmoe looking for a decent priced toaster that works fine and looks alright? This is probably in your wheelhouse. And yes, a 4 on one side might be a 3.5 on the other side. Drink your coffee, eat your toast and move on with your day, you have other things to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted. It makes anything from 1 to 4 slices, each done equally well. The doneness setting works as it should, and if you set it once it stays the same from then on. I’ve used it with both fresh and frozen bread with equal success. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisFromMaryland

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice toaster, but it had scratches on it when ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice toaster, but it had scratches on it when I got it, such a hassle to send back, so I just live with the s ratches.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Wide slots.
customer_reviews.text: Love, love this toaster. Quick and gets the toast just right. Nice wide openings perfect for bagels or home baked bread. Dependable settings. Toast pops up enough to get the slices out without getting burned fingers. We were replacing our 25 + year old toaster and this one does a great job with a nice stainless look.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Graham

customer_reviews.title: Love the color and works great for first year
customer_reviews.text: Had it about a year and one side is beginning to heat slowly. Sometimes have to do it twice. The other side still works well. But of course I need all 4 slices to cook right the first time!
customer_reviews.author: Miss America

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Love this toaster! Has worked great for 4 years! The frozen and bagel settings are great! Oster is a 5☆ brans for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Heather B

customer_reviews.title: Stylish looks and finish and a few extra setting options make this an easy choice.
customer_reviews.text: It makes toast, lol, its a solid product from a very decent company. If you are looking for a 4 slice toaster from a reputable company this will certainly fit your needs. Stylish looks and finish and a few extra setting options make this an easy choice.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D. Gifford

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: We have had this toaster for almost two years now. With a family of soon to be six, this toaster gets a daily workout. The bagel setting is fantastic and it is easy to clean. It looks great on the counter. Our last one only lasted about a year with the high usage so we were nervous about buying one a little more than the cheaper models but it has proven to be well invested money and we have not had a single issue with it. I think it would even make a nice house warming present for someone or a birthday present for that bagel lover in your life.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wessel

customer_reviews.title: This has been my greatest disappointment. I did so much research and did ...
customer_reviews.text: This has been my greatest disappointment. I did so much research and did like it for the first few weeks but now we are four months in and one side of the toaster (the left side) doesn't stay pushed down without great effort. The toast burns and often doesn't pop up in time and toasts unevenly. (case in point--fire alarm just went off when setting was at five for a piece of toast).
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Bain

customer_reviews.title: Not Built to Last
customer_reviews.text: In five months, it was failing. This toaster is not built to last. It's internal metal parts are very light, and the cassettes now get caught in their tracks. It looks good, and the price is great, but it's a waste of money. Spend a little more to get something that will continue to work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Parkway Runner

customer_reviews.title: died after 18 months
customer_reviews.text: worked fine for a while (except the bagel button which does nothing), but then stopped working after 18 months While it worked the toast was evenly cooked in a fairly short time
customer_reviews.author: Really....

customer_reviews.title: Best toaster I've owned
customer_reviews.text: 2 separate controls for 2 separate double toasting bays. Has buttons for special situations. The knobs seem to control the toasting level pretty darn well.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best toaster I have ever owned! It is beautiful but more important..completely accurate. English muffins #6, raisin toast #3. Use one side or both. When using both they pop up at same time at same setting. Recommend this toaster 100%
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla

customer_reviews.title: We really like the "reheat" setting for those mornings when we start ...
customer_reviews.text: Still working well after several months. We really like the "reheat" setting for those mornings when we start the toast and then don't get back to it until it's cold.
customer_reviews.author: MNMike

customer_reviews.title: Toaster lasted 9 months
customer_reviews.text: The toaster lasted 9 months and died. The only cool feature is the retractable cord. However, I called Oster directly and they are sending me a replacement. This model is no longer available.
customer_reviews.author: Monroe Twp., NJ Customer

customer_reviews.title: Feels flimsy, good toasting though.
customer_reviews.text: I had a four slice Cuisinart toaster before this that finally stopped toasting evenly so I bought this one that had good reviews. I have to put the handle down several times before it will "engage" and start toasting. Feels flimsy. Takes a long time to toast, but toasting is good. Ok, not great.
customer_reviews.author: Hurry Hurry

customer_reviews.title: Fail after 2 Months
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to do 4 slices at time - this toaster looks nice but was shaky from the start. Toaster settings never seemed to settle down. Over or under down most of the time. Could have lived with that I guess, but than the right side set failed. Construction is the type that's cheap to assembly but very difficult to take apart to repair. I am not going to try since I was not that happy with the toast.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. One More Time

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: It simply doesn't toast. It merely warms the bread. I had all four slots cranked up to the max setting, and still had to run the bread through twice. Also, although the slots are wide, they are not as long as my last toaster. It fit small pieces fine, but it barely fit what I would consider a medium sized slice of bread. It is a pretty toaster, though, with easy to use controls. Thumbs up for product design.
customer_reviews.author: Juloca

customer_reviews.title: Test it before toasting any bread !
customer_reviews.text: My brother was satisfied with this same make and model but when I received mine, I plugged it in to test the burners. Immediately smoke started coming from each section. The smell was like burnt plastic. After testing this for about 8 more cycles and the smoke still not going away, it was time to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: dad2ccc

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Will never by anything with oster name on ...
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Will never by anything with oster name on it. You have to push the down button five or six times at least before it will lock down and just go on. It's me cheap feels cheap now one side doesn't work at all it won't stay down or come on. If it goes down and stays down when the toast is completed it will pop up if you decide you want to toasted a little more forget it it will not go back down.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Rice

customer_reviews.title: Loving my new Oster toaster!!
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing, so far, that I don't like about my new Oster toaster!!! My last toaster was also an Oster and it was everything I ever wanted in a toaster, so I tried to find one as close to that...and I did!!. We have probably used it a dozen times, and haven't found anything about the toaster that we don't like. Bread, bagels, and frozen waffles have been toasted to perfection. I wish every product was this easy to love!!
customer_reviews.author: Gibby's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Crapped Out After less than four Years
customer_reviews.text: We very seldom use a toaster so when this one stopped working after slightly less than four years I was surprised. I would have thought that it would last longer since we seldom used it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works well, not perfect. Sometimes I get burned toast, sometimes the toast is just right. Perhaps it's the operator's fault, and not the toaster's fault, as it does have controls to change the time for how long the toast should be toasted. All in all, I'm satisfied with this toaster's performance.
customer_reviews.author: Kat V

customer_reviews.title: It's okay...
customer_reviews.text: It works fine except the metal on the inside that lifts the toast up is flimsy- ours actually bent. Also the lift up feature doesn't get the toast up high enough. They Cuisinart is better made, and of course a little more money.
customer_reviews.author: Joolie

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toaster a little over a year ago. I'm giving it 2 stars for the following: 1. Inconsistent when toasting. The same setting does not toast the same twice. Very difficult to find a setting that I can leave it on. 2. Even when I press bagel it still toasts both sides 3. The slots are short cannot accommodate rye toast or longer breads which are becoming more commonly available. 4. It broke after a year. Just died no indication nothing will work.
customer_reviews.author: Debra P

customer_reviews.title: So far ,so good.
customer_reviews.text: After an inordinate amount of research(more than any simple toaster should require) purchased this Oster model to replace a nice looking pink Cuisinart model that conked out in short order. Had Oster products in past that were good so we will see. Toasters are pretty simple and if this fails,its off to the antique store for one of those old round crome onesof yesteryear that used 1.21 gigawatts of juice but toasted bread. If they weren t good ,then how did they to be so old?
customer_reviews.author: Consumer66

customer_reviews.title: I love the long
customer_reviews.text: I love the long, retractable cord, as well as the ease of cooking bagels or toast, frozen or not. I really like that I don't have to worry about two sides of my bagel being toasted if I don't want it to be.
customer_reviews.author: robert d. metzger

customer_reviews.title: He is happily toasting each morning once again
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves toast. So, when the old toaster died just before our 30th anniversary, this was a must-have gift! He is happily toasting each morning once again! Simple toaster to use, clean design, hopefully it goes as long as the last one did.
customer_reviews.author: MI Farmerette

customer_reviews.title: ... my toaster hidden away but this one looks so nice so it's out on my counter all the time ...
customer_reviews.text: I've always kept my toaster hidden away but this one looks so nice so it's out on my counter all the time where my family can use it. I like all the button options. I also like the handles that push the food up a little higher so it's easier to get out when it's done toasting. It's a great product! We've been happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: CM25

customer_reviews.title: I love this toaster
customer_reviews.text: Omg! I have been looking for a red toaster for toast, bagels and toaster strudels and this is it! Easy to use! Easy to clean! Great for all your toaster needs. I like it because its not too big or too small. Great product and a really good brand. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Mrsc3burke

product_meta.title: Oster 4-Slice Toaster, Brushed Metal (TSSTTRWF4S-SHP)
product_meta.description: Color:Stainless SteelPrepare toast that perfectly suits your preferences using the Oster 4-Slice Toaster. With its four extra-wide slots, this bread toaster can easily accommodate bagels, homemade bread, English muffins, tea cakes, and more. Advanced Toasting Technology ensures consistent, even results every time, while dual bread guides automatically adjust to accommodate bread thickness, helping ensure even toasting. A user-friendly control panel with two dials allows you to easily adjust toast shade, while a high-lift lever elevates toast for easy retrieval. An anti-jam feature automatically shuts your toaster off in case of a jam for safe, hassle-free operation, and a cancel setting lets you stop the toasting process at any time. This 4-slice toaster also makes cleanup easiy thanks to its removable, dishwasher-safe crumb tray. Its brushed stainless steel finish offers a timeless look that coordinates with nearly any kitchen décor.
feature_bullets: 4-slice toaster with extra-wide slots accommodates a variety of items
Auto-adjusting bread guides for even, consistent toasting; toast-lift lever for easy retrieval
7 toast shade settings from light to dark and 4 modes: bagel, frozen, cancel, and reheat
Removable, dishwasher-safe crumb tray makes cleanup easy
NOTE: Refer user manual before use

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars2,511 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
